TypeSignature.Value: public sealed class DataGridColumnCollection : System.Collections.ICollection, System.Web.UI.IStateManager

.class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit DataGridColumnCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable, class System.Web.UI.IStateManager
Public NotInheritable Class DataGridColumnCollection Implements ICollection, IStateManager
public ref class DataGridColumnCollection sealed : System::Collections::ICollection, System::Web::UI::IStateManager

summary.span: 派生的列对象的集合，这些对象表示 控件中的列。

span.span: A collection of -derived column objects that represent the columns in a control.

summary.span: 此类不能被继承。

span.span: This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用集合以编程方式管理一套-派生列对象。Use the collection to programmatically manage a collection of -derived column objects. 这些对象表示中的列控件。These objects represent the columns in a control. 你可以添加、 删除或插入列中的集合。You can add, remove, or insert columns in the collection. > [!NOTE] > 当属性设置为`true,`通过列控件不会添加到集合。When the property is set to `true,` the columns created by the control are not added to the collection. 控件的内容不存储其中的视图状态的集合。The control does not store the contents of its collection in the view state. 若要动态添加或移除列，您必须以编程方式添加或删除列，每次刷新页面。To add or remove a column dynamically, you must programmatically add or remove the column every time the page is refreshed. 提供`Page_Init`添加或删除前面的列的函数重新加载控件的状态，并重新生成该控件。Provide a `Page_Init` function that adds or removes the column before the control's state is reloaded and the control is rebuilt. 否则为对更改集合不会反映在控制显示时。Otherwise, the changes to the collection are not reflected in the control when it is displayed. > [!NOTE] > 但是你也可以以编程方式将列添加到或删除列从集合控件，它是更轻松地以静态方式列出的列，然后使用属性来显示或隐藏每个列。Although you can programmatically add columns to or remove columns from the collection of the control, it is easier to list the columns statically and then use the property to display or hide each column. 集合中的列的顺序确定在显示的列的顺序控件。The order of the columns in the collection determines the order that the columns are displayed in the control. 下表列出的不同列类派生自类。The following table lists the different column classes that derive from the class. |列类Column Class|描述Description| |------------------|-----------------| ||绑定到数据源中的字段的列。A column that is bound to a field in a data source. 它显示为文本的字段中的每个项。It displays each item in the field as text. 这是默认列类型控件。This is the default column type for the control.| ||显示每个项的命令按钮列中的列。A column that displays a command button for each item in the column. 这样，您可以创建自定义按钮控件，如添加或删除的按钮的列。This allows you to create a column of custom button controls, such as Add or Remove buttons.| ||一列以包含列中每个项的编辑命令。A column that contains editing commands for each item in the column.| ||为超链接列中显示每个项的列。A column that displays each item in the column as a hyperlink. 列的内容可以绑定到数据源中的字段或静态文本。The contents of the column can be bound to a field in a data source, or to static text.| ||根据指定的模板列中显示每个项的列。A column that displays each item in the column according to a specified template. 这样，你可以控制列，例如，若要显示图像的内容。This allows you to control the content of the column, for example to display images.| > [!NOTE] > 类是列出的列类的基类。The class is the base class for the column classes listed. 它不用于直接在集合。It is not used directly in the collection. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用要动态添加到列集合控件。The following code example demonstrates how to use the collection to dynamically add a column to the control. 请注意，属性控件是的一个实例类。Note that the property of the control is an instance of the class. [!code-aspx-csharp[DataGridCtor#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DataGridCtor/CS/datagridctorcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[DataGridCtor#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DataGridCtor/VB/datagridctorvb.aspx#1)]

summary.span: 将指定的由 导出的列对象追加到 集合的结尾。

span.span: Appends the specified -derived column object to the end of the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用此方法将添加的左边缘派生列对象集合。Use this method to add a -derived column object to the end of a collection. 控件的内容不存储其中的视图状态的集合。The control does not store the contents of its collection in the view state. 若要动态添加或移除列，必须以编程方式添加或删除列每次刷新页面时。To add or remove a column dynamically, you must programmatically add or remove the column each time the page is refreshed. 提供`Page_Init`添加或删除前面的列的函数控件可以重新加载其状态并重新生成它自身。Provide a `Page_Init` function that adds or removes the column before the control can reload its state and rebuild itself. 否则为对更改集合不会反映在控制显示时。Otherwise, the changes to the collection are not reflected in the control when it is displayed. > [!NOTE] > 但是你也可以以编程方式将列添加到或删除列从集合控件，它是更轻松地以静态方式列出的列，然后使用属性来显示或隐藏每个列。Although you can programmatically add columns to or remove columns from the collection of the control, it is easier to list the columns statically and then use the property to display or hide each column. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用方法将动态添加的列控件。The following code example demonstrates how to use the method to dynamically add a column to the control. 请注意，属性控件是的一个实例类。Note that the property of the control is an instance of the class. [!code-aspx-csharp[DataGridCtor#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DataGridCtor/CS/datagridctorcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[DataGridCtor#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DataGridCtor/VB/datagridctorvb.aspx#1)]

span.span: A interface that contains all -derived column objects in the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用此方法创建可以轻松循环获取每个项的接口集合。Use this method to create a interface that can be iterated through easily to get each item in the collection. 使用当前获取的项的属性指向集合中。Use the property to get the item currently pointed to in the collection. 使用方法将移动到集合中的下一项。Use the method to move to the next item in the collection. 使用方法将枚举器移到初始位置。Use the method to move the enumerator to the initial position. > [!NOTE] > 方法必须在创建之后调用对象，或使用方法将枚举器移动到集合中的第一项。The method must be called after creating a object, or after using the method to move the enumerator to the first item in the collection. 否则，表示的项属性是不确定。Otherwise, the item represented by the property is undefined. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用方法来创建可以循环访问以显示的内容的接口集合。The following code example demonstrates how to use the method to create a interface that can be iterated though to display the contents of the collection.
